A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
Will we look back years from now and recognize this as the movie that killed Star Wars? I think it's a real possibility. 

There were positives: good jokes\, good acting\, some cool scenes and plot points. 

But the negatives--oh the negatives--which we can all but fit under a single umbrella; that being: the misuse and seeming disrespect of the characters\, mythology and spirit of the movies that came before (including The Force Awakens). Kylo Ren is perhaps the only character that does not fall under this category (unless you consider the Porgs and Droids as characters). The rest were poorly handled.

Don't get me started on Luke Skywalker. His first reaction to having a lightsaber in his hand again was to throw it away like a piece of garbage. Unfortunately\, that moment was symbolic of the movie as a whole.

I am not suggesting that Rian Johnson intentionally set out to disrespect (destroy?) Star Wars. Or to make a bad movie. But we all make mistakes... this movie was a mistake.
